get.description: Retrieves a list of active, draft, and inactive journeys using scope authentication.

post.description: Create a journey with configuration for goal, deadline, and initial settings.

put.description: Updates properties of a specific journey such as name, description, chart data, goal, and deadlines.

get.description: Retrieve detailed data for a specific journey including stages, transitions, chart data, goals, deadlines, and action metadata.

delete.description: Delete a journey by specifying its ID.

post.description: Duplicate a journey instead of editing a published one.
Merge an edited journey with the original journey by publishing the changes.
Activate a journey that is currently in a deactivated state.
Pause the execution of a journey by deactivating it.

get.summary: Get all transitions for a journey
get.description: The GET Journey Transitions API allows users to retrieve all configured transitions for a specific journey using the journey ID. It's a read-only operation.

204.description: No transitions found for the specified journey.

post.summary: Create a new transition that connects two stages within a journey, triggered either by a signal or after a specified wait time.
post.description: Creates a new transition that connects two stages within a journey. The transition can be triggered either by an incoming signal or after a specified wait time.

put.summary: Update an existing transition in a journey.
put.description: Allows updating a transitionâ€™s name, description, stages, wait parameters, triggers, logs, criteria, and identifiers. Bulk updates are not supported.

get.description: The GET Journey Transition Details API allows users to retrieve specific journey's specific transition's all details and configured triggers by using journey and transition ID. It's a read-only operation, typically returning data in JSON.

delete.description: The DELETE Journey Transition API allows users to delete a particular journey's transition by specifying the transition id.

post.description: The POST Journey Stages API is designed for users to create stages within a journey. This operation is write-only, meaning it's used for submitting data rather than retrieving it. Typically, when a stage is successfully created, the API returns a response in JSON format indicating success.

get.summary: Get all stages for a journey
get.description: The GET Journey Stages API allows users to retrieve a specific journey's all stages. It's a read-only operation, typically returning data in JSON.

204.description: No stages found for the specified journey.

put.description: Allows updating properties of a specific stage such as name, description, type, and end_stage.

get.description: The GET Journey Stage Details API allows users to retrieve a specific journey's specific stage's details by using journey and stage ID. It's a read-only operation, typically returning data in JSON.

delete.description: The DELETE Journey Stage API allows users to delete a particular journey's stage by specifying stage id.

post.description: In journey, we have two types of variables; they are user-defined and system-defined, but through API we can create only user-defined variables. In user defined variables, we can configure two types of user-defined variables like merge and custom. In merge, we can give any field as a value; in custom type, all values will be considered strings.

207.description: Partial success or multi-status response for variable creation. This code may be returned if some variables were created successfully while others failed due to specific constraints (e.g., duplicates, invalid data).

get.summary: Get all variables for a journey
get.description: The GET Journeys Variables API is designed to fetch a comprehensive list of all variables related to a specific journey, including both user-defined and system-defined variables. To utilize this API, the journey's ID is required. This API performs a read-only operation and typically returns the data in JSON format.

204.description: No variables found for the specified journey.

put.description: The PUT Journey Variable API enables users to update system-defined variable name and user-defined variable names and values.

get.description: The GET Journeys Variable Details API is designed to fetch a comprehensive details of a variable related to a specific journey, including both user-defined and system-defined variables. To utilize this API, the journey and variable ID is required. This API performs a read-only operation and typically returns the data in JSON format.

delete.description: The DELETE Journey Variable is used to remove custom variables by specifying the variable Id, but the user is not able to delete system-defined variables.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all service organizations.
Retrieves a list of all available signals.

JourneyId.name: journey_id
JourneyId.description: The unique identifier of the journey.

IncludeParam.name: include
IncludeParam.description: Comma-separated list of additional metadata to include (e.g., stages, transitions)

FiltersParam.name: filters
FiltersParam.description: Filter expression to narrow down the results. This string must be URL-encoded before sending in the query. Example filter: {"field":{"api_name":"transition"},"comparator":"equal","value":"1000000004349"}

TransitionId.name: transition_id
TransitionId.description: The unique identifier of the transition to be retrieved or modified.

PerPage.name: per_page
PerPage.description: To specify the number of records per page. Default is 200.

IncludeInnerDetailsParam.name: include_inner_details
IncludeInnerDetailsParam.description: To get extra details in lookup fields. Possible values: "triggers.identifiers.ui_type", "triggers.identifiers.data_type", "triggers.signal.org.type", "from_stage.end_stage", "to_stage.end_stage"

IncludeOuterDetailsParam.name: include_outer_details
IncludeOuterDetailsParam.description: To get extra outer details about the fields. Possible values: "identifier_meta"

StageId.name: stage_id
StageId.description: The unique identifier of the stage.

VariableId.name: variable_id
VariableId.description: The unique identifier of the variable.

CreateJourneyErrorResponse.description: One of the possible error responses for journey creation

UpdateJourneyErrorResponse.description: One of the error responses for updating a journey

GetJourneyDetailsResponse.description: Single journey with full details or an error

InvalidRequestErrorResponse.description: Request payload is invalid or missing required fields

JourneyActionErrorResponse.description: Invalid data or not allowed action for publishing, cloning, or merging a journey.

CreateUpdateResourceErrorResponse.description: Common error responses for creating or updating resources (e.g., transition, stage).

GetTransitionDetailsResponse.description: Details of a specific transition retrieved successfully

GetStageDetailsResponse.description: Details of a specific stage retrieved successfully

CreateVariableErrorResponse.description: Error response for creating a variable

GetVariableDetailsResponse.description: Details of a specific variable retrieved successfully

UpdateVariableErrorResponse.description: Error response for updating a variable

GetServiceOrgsResponse.description: List of service organizations retrieved successfully

description.description: A short description of the journey

journeys.description: List of journey-level responses or results.

items.description: Detailed journey object with nested metadata (stages, transitions, etc.)

api_name.description: API name of the configurable field.

page.description: Current page number in the paginated response.

count.description: Number of records returned in the current page.

per_page.description: Maximum number of records per page.

more_records.description: Indicates if more records are available beyond the current page.

transitions.description: List of transition objects to be created. Currently, only one transition can be created per request.

_delete.description: If true, deletes the object it is associated with. Requires the 'id' field.

add_identifiers_to_similar_triggers.description: If true, identifiers will be added to similar triggers sharing the same criteria.

id.description: Unique identifier of the object or entity.

criteria.description: Defines the logical structure of conditions used to evaluate a trigger. Set to null to delete.
Defines the logical structure of conditions used to evaluate a trigger. Set to null to delete.

identifiers.description: List of identifiers used to map data between CRM and system.

Criteria.description: Defines conditional logic for triggers or transition criteria. Use a single condition object when only one field is involved. Use 'group_operator' and 'group' when multiple field-based conditions need to be evaluated together.

group_operator.description: Logical operator (AND/OR) used when defining criteria for multiple fields. This field is required only when more than one condition is grouped.

group.description: An array of conditions or nested groups. Should be used only when criteria involve multiple fields.

description.description: A brief description about the transition

from_stage.description: ID reference to the starting stage of the transition. Nullable except for WaitTransition and WaitUpdateTransition.

UnifiedTransitionBase.description: Base schema for both Create and Update transitions. Required fields vary by operation.

Identifier.description: Defines identifiers associated with a trigger, used for CRM or synced field mappings. Required fields depend on context.

id.description: Required when deleting the identifier (`_delete: true`) or when `type` is `synced_fields`.

api_name.description: API name of the field or object being identified.

type.description: The source type of the identifier. Use `synced_fields` for system-synced fields and `crm_fields` for user-defined fields.

_delete.description: Set to `true` to delete the identifier. When true, `id` must be provided.

comparator.description: Operator used to compare the value of a field (e.g., equal, not_equal).

value.description: Value to be compared or logged.
Value for custom type. Any string is allowed.

id.description: Unique identifier of the log entry. Required only when updating or deleting an existing log.

_delete.description: Set to true to delete this log entry. Requires 'id' to be specified.

name.description: Descriptive name of the log entry. Used when creating or updating a log.

TransitionLogBase.description: Base schema for transition log entries. Common fields shared by all log types. Use 'id' and '_delete' only when deleting a log. For creating a new log, only 'name', 'type', and 'value' are required and sufficient.

end_stage.description: Indicates if this is the final stage.

tp_actions.description: This field is currently not supported in version 1 of the API.

id.description: ID is generated by the server upon creation and should not be provided in the payload.
The unique identifier of the stage. This field is read-only and should not be provided in the payload as it's a path parameter.

type.description: Layout behavior type â€” must be 'any' or 'specific' if layout is present.

precedence_order.description: Defines the execution order for this transition relative to others.

logs.description: Contains log actions to be executed with this transition. Each log must include a name, type, and value.

transition_criteria.description: This field is currently not supported in version 1 of the API.

id.description: The unique identifier of the variable.

generated_type.description: Indicates if the variable is system-defined or user-defined.

items.description: Properties to update for a variable. 'id' is a path parameter and not included here. All fields are optional for update.

signal_condition.description: Whether the signal uses condition-based logic.

required.description: Whether this signal property must be provided.

api_name.description: Technical name used internally to reference this property.

parent_prop.description: Parent property this is dependent on, if any.

data_type.description: Type of value expected (e.g., object, array).

code.description: A short machine-readable code indicating the outcome or error type.

message.description: Human-readable description explaining the status or error.

status.description: The status of the response: success or error.
